cleaned_text: & Forms](/fees-insurance-and-forms) [UPDATE](https://covid.oregonstate.edu/latest-updates/update-osus-covid-19-vaccination-requirement): Effective June 16, 2023, Oregon State University will no longer require proof of COVID-19 vaccination. --- NEW: Starting April 3, 2023, and in accordance with [Oregon Health Authority guidance](https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/ORDHS/bulletins/34c69c1), employees, patients and visitors within campus health care settings will no longer be required to wear masks. NEW: Starting April 3, 2023, Oregon OSHA is suspending all [COVID-19-related rules](https://osha.oregon.gov/OSHARules/adopted/2023/ao1-2023-letter-temp-cov19-suspension.pdf). We are here to serve the students and tailor our services to their individual and population-level needs. Resources are available 24 hours a day! IMPORTANT: Anyone with viral symptoms, sinus pressure and pain, sore throat, cough or any combination of these should self-isolate immediately. Students feeling unwell: Students with mild or no symptoms: Immunizations offer safe, effective protection from vaccine-preventable diseases. This is especially true for students living in group housing on or off campus. By reducing cases and outbreaks of significant infectious diseases, immunizations help students stay in class and achieve their academic goals. OSU Student Health offers the Pfizer bivalent booster. Call [541-737-9355](tel:541-737-9355) to make an appointment. Questions? Call the Immunization Helpline
